definitions: profession or business of cutting and styling people's hair
examples: She studied hairdressing at the beauty college
The hairdressing salon was busy every Saturday

definitions: edge of hair growth on the head, especially on forehead
examples: His hairline had receded significantly over the years
The barber carefully trimmed around her hairline

definitions: thin U-shaped pin used to hold hair in place
examples: She secured her bun with several bobby hairpins
The dancer's hairpins kept falling out during practice

definitions: particular way in which someone's hair is cut and arranged
examples: The new hairstyle made her look years younger
Fashion magazines showcased the latest hairstyle trends

definitions: pilgrimage to Mecca that every Muslim must make at least once
examples: Thousands of pilgrims began their haj journey to Mecca
He saved money for years to perform the haj

definitions: annual pilgrimage to Mecca required of all able Muslims once in lifetime
examples: The hajj brings millions of Muslims together each year
She completed her hajj during the holy month

definitions: marine fish similar to cod commonly used for food
examples: The restaurant served pan-fried hake with lemon sauce
Fresh hake was available at the fish market

definitions: food or practices permissible according to Islamic law
examples: The restaurant serves only halal meat dishes
She looked for the halal certification on the package

definitions: defensive or offensive player positioned behind the forward line in football
examples: The halfback scored two goals in the championship match
He played halfback for his college football team

definitions: former British coin worth half of one penny
examples: The old halfpenny coins are now collectors' items
Candy cost just a halfpenny in those days

definitions: interval between two halves of a game or match
examples: The coach gave an inspiring speech during halftime
Fans bought snacks during the halftime break

definitions: large flatfish found in northern seas valued as food
examples: The chef prepared grilled halibut with herb butter
Halibut fishing season begins in early spring

definitions: exclamation of praise or joy used especially in religious contexts
examples: The congregation sang hallelujah during the service
She shouted hallelujah when she heard the good news

definitions: typical characteristic or feature that identifies something
official mark stamped on precious metals to certify purity
examples: Excellence in service is the hallmark of this hotel
Attention to detail became her professional hallmark
The jeweler examined the hallmark on the silver bracelet
Each piece bore the craftsman's distinctive hallmark

definitions: experience of seeing or hearing things that are not actually present
examples: The fever caused vivid hallucinations during the night
The doctor asked about any hallucinations or unusual visions

definitions: circle of light shown around holy person's head in art
ring of light appearing to surround luminous body
examples: Angels in the painting each had a golden halo
The saint's halo glowed brightly in the stained glass
The moon had a beautiful halo on that foggy night
A halo effect surrounded the street lights

definitions: group of chemical elements including fluorine, chlorine, bromine, and iodine
examples: Halogen lamps produce very bright white light
The chemistry student studied halogen reactions

definitions: suspension of movement or activity; a complete stop
examples: The train came to a sudden halt at the station
Production came to a halt during the strike

definitions: rope or strap placed around horse's head for leading
woman's top held up by straps around the neck
examples: She put a halter on the horse before leading it
The leather halter was decorated with silver studs
She wore a stylish halter to the beach party
The halter top was perfect for summer weather

definitions: meat from upper part of pig's leg preserved by salting or smoking
actor who overacts or exaggerates their performance
examples: They served honey-glazed ham for Easter dinner
She bought sliced ham for sandwiches
That actor is such a ham on stage
He was hamming it up for the cameras

definitions: sandwich consisting of cooked ground beef patty in a bun
examples: He ordered a hamburger with extra cheese and bacon
The diner serves the best hamburgers in town

definitions: small settlement or village smaller than a town
examples: The quiet hamlet had only fifty residents
They discovered a picturesque hamlet in the mountains

definitions: shark with flattened head extended sideways in hammer shape
examples: The hammerhead shark swam close to the diving boat
Hammerheads use their wide heads to detect prey

definitions: action of hitting something repeatedly with force
examples: The constant hammering from construction kept neighbors awake
The hammering of rain on the roof was deafening

definitions: hanging bed made of canvas or rope netting suspended between supports
examples: She relaxed in the hammock under palm trees
They hung a hammock between two trees in the backyard

definitions: large basket used for holding dirty laundry
basket containing food and other items given as gift
examples: The dirty clothes overflowed from the laundry hamper
She carried the hamper to the washing machine
They received a luxury hamper filled with gourmet treats
The Christmas hamper included wine and chocolates

definitions: small rodent with pouches in cheeks kept as pet
examples: The hamster ran on its wheel throughout the night
Children love watching hamsters stuff their cheek pouches

definitions: tendon at back of knee connecting thigh muscles to bones
examples: The athlete suffered a painful hamstring injury
Stretching helps prevent hamstring pulls

definitions: small bag carried by women for personal items
examples: She searched through her handbag for the keys
The designer handbag matched her shoes perfectly

definitions: team sport where players hit ball with hands to score goals
examples: The handball championship attracted teams from across Europe
She played handball professionally for ten years

definitions: book giving information or instructions about a subject
examples: The employee handbook explained company policies clearly
Students received a handbook on the first day

definitions: small firearm designed to be held and fired with one hand
examples: Police officers carry handguns for protection
The detective placed his handgun in the holster

definitions: physical or mental condition that limits person's movements or activities
system in sports giving disadvantaged players an advantage
examples: Despite her visual handicap, she excelled in music
The building was modified to accommodate physical handicaps
His golf handicap improved after months of practice
The race used a handicap system to level competition

definitions: people who have physical or mental disabilities
examples: The parking spaces for handicapped individuals are clearly marked
The center provides services for handicapped children

definitions: decorative object made by hand using traditional skills
examples: The market sold beautiful handicrafts from local artisans
She learned traditional handicraft techniques from her grandmother

definitions: something made or done by hand; result of someone's work
examples: The quilt was a fine example of her handiwork
Vandals left their destructive handiwork throughout the park

definitions: small square of cloth used for wiping nose or face
examples: He pulled out a handkerchief to wipe his forehead
She embroidered her initials on the silk handkerchief

definitions: curved metal bar used for steering bicycle or motorcycle
examples: He gripped the handlebar tightly while riding downhill
The motorcycle's handlebar was customized with leather grips

definitions: person who manages or deals with something
person who trains or controls animals
examples: The baggage handlers loaded luggage onto the plane
She worked as a customer complaint handler
The dog handler demonstrated obedience training techniques
Wildlife handlers must take special safety precautions

definitions: way of dealing with or managing something
examples: Proper handling of chemicals requires safety equipment
The handling of customer complaints improved significantly

definitions: female servant or personal attendant to a woman
examples: The queen's handmaid helped her dress each morning
Historical novels often feature loyal handmaids

definitions: act of passing something from one person to another
examples: The quarterback's handoff to the running back was smooth
The project handoff between teams went seamlessly

definitions: act of giving control or responsibility to someone else
examples: The handover of power occurred at midnight
They prepared documents for the business handover

definitions: rail fixed to wall or posts for people to hold while walking
examples: She held the handrail while climbing the steep stairs
Safety regulations require handrails on both sides

definitions: part of telephone held to ear and mouth when speaking
examples: She picked up the handset to answer the call
The cordless handset needed charging

definitions: act of shaking hands as greeting or to seal agreement
examples: They sealed the deal with a firm handshake
His handshake conveyed confidence and warmth

definitions: person's particular style of writing by hand
examples: The teacher praised her neat handwriting
Doctors are notorious for their illegible handwriting

definitions: person skilled at doing various repairs and maintenance tasks
examples: The handyman fixed the leaky faucet and creaky door
She hired a handyman to install new shelves
